cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles ESE of Miami Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then turning NW late Saturday, on a track toward the Florida Keys and South Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / extreme South Florida (near Miami-Dade–Monroe county line)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (to the north of Jupiter Inlet) – PortMiami itself is in a Warning area
weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet and north of Bonita Beach to Anna Maria Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Jupiter Inlet through the Keys, including Miami-Dade County
weather_observation.wind: Major hurricane winds possible; 64-kt (hurricane-force) probability 57% and 50-kt probability 80% within 5 days at Miami
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Warning in effect; 5–10 ft possible from Jupiter Inlet southward including Biscayne Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated 20 inches forecast for southeast Florida, causing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, large destructive waves, possible tornadoes embedded in rain bands
